title: St. Expeditus Novena
description: St Expeditus (also known as St Expedite), was a Roman centurion and Catholic convert in Armenia martyred in April, 303. He is the patron saint of urgent causes, emergencies, lawsuits, expeditious solutions, against procrastination, merchants, navigators, sailors, students, programmers, and hackers.

days.prayer:
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Act of Contrition Lord Jesus Christ, I am heartily sorry for my sins. Grant me, therefore, pardon of my sins and the grace I ask of You through the merits of the sorrows of Your loving Mother and the virtues of Your martyr, Saint Expeditus. (mention request here‚Ä¶)

O Glorious Martyr, St. Expeditus, through the enviable hope given you by God, pray that those of little belief may be penetrated by some rays of hope so that they may also receive eternal things, please pray that ardent hope in God be also given me and hold me steadfast in the midst of sufferings.

O Saint Expeditus, my protector, in you I place my hope that my petitions may be granted if they are for my own good. Please ask Our Lord, through the intercession of the Blessed Virgin, for the forgiveness of my sins, and the grace to change my life, particularly the grace I ask in this novena, and I promise to follow your example and propagate this devotion to you. (Now pray three Our Fathers in honor of the Most Holy Trinity.)

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

I recently went through a very difficult time due to a medical condition. My initial test results came back positive for a potentially deadly disease. I was terrified, anxious, and felt completely helpless, not knowing what to do or who to turn to. The doctors needed to run follow-up tests, which took almost four weeks. During that waiting period, I turned to prayer. I began praying the Novena to St. Jude, along with the Novena to St. Expedite and the Novena to the Infant Jesus. I went to church every morning, asking God for a miracle, mercy, healing, and forgiveness. After four weeks, the follow-up results came back completely negative. The relief was overwhelming, and I truly believe this was nothing short of a medical miracle through the power of prayer. This experience has deepened my faith, and I sincerely hope that anyone reading this will believe in God and in the power of prayer.
